callouts: Utilize the 'Main Screen Preview' panel on the right side of the screen to see a real-time preview of your branding changes before saving.
Ensure your Hero Image file does not exceed the maximum file size of 5 MB as indicated on the screen.
For the best results, use a PNG file format for your Logo Image.

nextSteps: Verify the new branding on a physical kiosk device to ensure it appears as expected.
Explore other options within the Settings menu to further customize your system.

paragraphs: You have successfully customized the branding for your 6IX Kiosk. By following the steps in this guide, you can align the kiosk's appearance with your brand identity by updating the logo, color scheme, tagline, and hero image for any selected venue.

introduction.audience: System administrators and managers responsible for brand management.
introduction.purpose: This document provides a step-by-step guide on how to customize the visual branding of the 6IX Kiosk application through the settings console.
introduction.scope: This guide covers all the branding customization options available on the '6IX Kiosk Branding' screen. This includes selecting a venue, uploading a logo and hero image, setting primary and secondary colors, and defining a custom tagline. It does not cover the 'Kiosk Branding' or 'FanVista Branding' tabs.
outcomes: Navigate to the 6IX Kiosk branding settings.
Select a specific venue to apply branding.
Upload and crop a custom logo.
Define a primary and secondary color scheme.
Upload and crop a hero image.
Save and apply the branding changes.
prerequisites: Valid user credentials with access to the settings console.
Logo and hero image files prepared for upload (e.g., PNG for the logo).

shortDescription: A comprehensive guide on how to configure and apply custom branding, including logos, colors, and images, to the 6IX Kiosk for specific venues.

steps.explanation: Begin by accessing the main configuration area of the application.
steps.step: From the main dashboard, navigate to the left sidebar and click on 'Settings'.

steps.explanation: This will take you to the branding configuration section for various applications.
steps.step: On the Settings page, under the 'General' section, click on the 'Branding' icon.

steps.explanation: This section contains the specific branding options for the self-service kiosk.
steps.step: At the top of the Branding page, click on the '6IX Kiosk Branding' tab.

steps.explanation: Branding settings are applied on a per-venue basis, allowing for unique branding at different locations.
steps.step: Click the 'Select Venue' dropdown menu and choose the venue you wish to customize.

steps.explanation: This will be the main logo displayed on the kiosk's home screen.
steps.step: In the 'Logo Image (PNG)' section, click the area labeled 'Click or drop your file here to upload' and select your logo file from your computer.

steps.explanation: The cropping tool ensures your logo fits correctly within the designated space on the kiosk screen.
steps.step: In the 'Crop Logo Image' window that appears, adjust the selection to fit your logo as desired, then click the 'CROP AND UPLOAD' button.

steps.explanation: This text appears below the logo and can be used for a slogan or welcome message.
steps.step: Click inside the 'Tag Line' text field and enter your desired tagline.

steps.explanation: The hero image is a large background or banner image that enhances the visual appeal of the kiosk.
steps.step: Under the 'Hero Image' section, click the 'Upload Image' button and select your hero image file.

steps.explanation: Similar to the logo, cropping the hero image ensures it displays correctly on the kiosk.
steps.step: In the 'Crop Logo Image' window, adjust the image as needed and click 'CROP AND UPLOAD'.

steps.explanation: This action applies all the configured branding changes to the selected venue's kiosk.
steps.step: After reviewing your changes in the preview panel, click the 'Save' button located at the top right of the page to apply your new branding.

title: Configuring 6IX Kiosk Branding
